data.title: implement smooth scrolling speed setting
data.body:
a general scroll speed setting in the same manner sublime "scroll_speed" (http://docs.sublimetext.info/en/latest/reference/settings.html)  

why ?
the current atom editor has all the proper looks like any other major one, but severely lacks the feeling. Sublime, textmate and others have implemented smooth scrolling which gives an easy to fallow sensation when scrolling thru the code, this is a feature that makes an incredibly difference in terms of comfort and new users adoption.

whats wrong with the current alternatives ?
the css wont work with the new tile rendering system, see https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5359
"scroll sensitivity" works only when using a mouse or trackpad, besides the "steeps" between every scroll update aren't smooth at all.

I propose an artificial delay in the same way that a linear transition of -webkit-transform would work over the tiles.

rel https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/1666

data.title: After uninstalling Atom, option "open with Atom" is shown
data.body:
### Description

I uninstalled Atom. I noticed that when I right clicked an expansion drive I got the "open with Atom" option, and then an error saying "Application not found".

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5374887/19017841/0d16d85e-8821-11e6-9b8b-1cbd96b56c31.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5374887/19017843/0fceca0c-8821-11e6-96aa-ab6334548125.png)

data.title: Add special character to represent soft wrap at the end of line
data.body: ### Proposal Other editors or IDE, such as WebStorm, has little character representing soft wrap at the end of the line. Currently Atom has only dot marker on the lines number column. Special character at the end of the line is much more helpful when reading or editing long lines in text files, such as `.md`-files. Having additional option under _Editor â†’ Invisibles_ can be very useful. What do you think about it? ### Example from WebStorm IDE

data.title: Fixed broken links to the atom repo
data.body: All of the links to label searches were broken, pointing to a 404 page. I've fixed these links so anyone looking to contribute to the project doesn't get stuck on a bunch of broken links.

data.title: Fix: Scroll line vertically to the center if opened with initialRow
data.body:
Fixes issue #12253 

Added `center: true` for autoscroll to get this behaviour.

Also, regarding the specs, I couldn't find any existing behaviour tests that can distinguish between `center: true` and `center: false` for `autoscroll`. The current `initialLine` tests are [here](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/706eea2f4298e990a81d117414c766be53146251/spec/workspace-spec.coffee#L385) and the `autoscroll tests` are [here](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/706eea2f4298e990a81d117414c766be53146251/spec/text-editor-component-spec.js#L4814) (These just check if there is a certain amount of scroll amount from top and not whether the actual location of the cursor is in the center of the displayed screen )

Will add specs if someone can suggest how to proceed.

data.title: This is a test
data.body: This is a pull request

data.title: Constant Crash on Ubuntu, reproducable
data.body:
_Update: reproduction steps described below. problem appears related to the hover bubble over files  in the file tree._

After some time of running `atom --safe` (1.10.2) it crashes. The nature of the crash is that the window remains open but when I resize the window the canvas does not update. I am no longer able to scroll in the tabs open or do anything with atom other than forcefully quit it. The system I am running on in Ubuntu 14.04.4LTS with Gnome 3.12.2.

I've had this issue consistently through various atom versions. Because atom does an okay job in recovering the previous open state, and because most of my projects involve git which means I'm saving a lot, it doesn't bother me too much. But often I'll get frustrated and update my atom (compiling from latest stable) in hopes it is fixed. 

I would love to figure out how to reproduce this but I haven't found it yet. It seems to happen only when I'm working on a tree of files, and have a few tabs open at least. Then after about 10 or 15 minutes I will be scrolling and it will lock up.

data.title: Fixes search links for GitHub Issues and Pull Requests
data.body:
https://github.com/issues and https://github.com/pulls URLs ~~stopped working in the last couple of days~~ do not work for non-logged-in users.

This changes the URLs used in atom to point to https://github.com/search.

It might not be a problem if most users of atom are already logged in, but would they know that logging in would fix the problem?

data.title: window:focus-pane-on-right/left not working in large window
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

`window:focus-pane-on-right` and `window:focus-pane-on-left` don't work when the window is greater than the breakpoint between the `minimum` and the largest `even` tab sizes when the setting is `auto`.

It seems to only be a problem with `-left` and `-right`, `focus-pane-above`, `focus-pane-below`, `focus-previous-pane`, and `focus-next-pane` work fine in all sizes.

Small window, minimum-style tabs, `window:focus-pane-on-left/right` works correctly:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3939997/18998792/be070904-86ff-11e6-915e-b2e19926d400.png)

Wide and short window, medium-sized even-style tabs, `window:focus-pane-on-left/right` works correctly:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3939997/18998893/27f6e53c-8700-11e6-849f-ea444014009c.png)

Large window, even-style tabs,  `window:focus-pane-on-left/right` does nothing:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3939997/18998900/3397e594-8700-11e6-9e71-026228d1fdea.png)

Small behavior:
![focus pane works](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3939997/18998964/92ba5a0c-8700-11e6-8dea-76a6cfb6a397.gif)

Large behavior:
![doesnt work](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3939997/18998967/971e9bd0-8700-11e6-88b0-bac6bce95133.gif)

Apologies for the poor/weird recording in those gifs, screen recording works poorly on my work desktop for some reason.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Fullscreen the window
2. Call `window:focus-pane-on-right`

**Expected behavior:** Pane on right is focused.

**Actual behavior:** Current pane is still focused.
### Versions

Platform: Arch Linux x64

`$ atom --version`
Atom    : 1.10.2
Electron: 1.4.1
Chrome  : 53.0.2785.113
Node    : 6.5.0

data.title: 1.5 releases
Uncaught Error: Cannot read property 'object' of undefinedTypeError: Cannot read property 'objec...
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]

data.title: On Circle, clear screensaver right before running tests
data.body:
We're seeing some Circle builds time out, and we think it may be because after sending the keystroke, enough time is elapsing during our tests that the screensaver is _still_ starting.

Example: https://circleci.com/gh/atom/atom/1287

data.title: Fix uses of `call-window-method` IPC channel in specs
data.body:
Refs https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12759

In that PR, we broke the ability to toggle the dev tools and reload spec windows.

data.title: Guard against null tab length value
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/12575

ðŸ 'd with @as-cii

data.title: Fixes documentation for TextEditor::indentationForBufferRow()
data.body:
fixes #12820. 

The problem was that lines beginning with `Returns` are [special in atomdoc](https://github.com/atom/atomdoc/blob/f2917a6433b72f8fafb89f5fcff7060a450fa661/src/parser.coffee#L10)  so I replaced it with `Determines`.
# New atom-api.json

``` json
{
  "name": "indentationForBufferRow",
  "sectionName": "Indentation",
  "srcUrl": "https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/v1.12.0-dev/src/text-editor.coffee#L2943",
  "visibility": "Essential",
  "summary": "Get the indentation level of the given buffer row.",
  "description": "Get the indentation level of the given buffer row.\n\nDetermines how deeply the given row is indented based on the soft tabs and\ntab length settings of this editor. Note that if soft tabs are enabled and\nthe tab length is 2, a row with 4 leading spaces would have an indentation\nlevel of 2.",
  "arguments": [
    {
      "name": "bufferRow",
      "description": "A {Number} indicating the buffer row.",
      "type": "Number",
      "isOptional": false
    }
  ],
  "returnValues": [
    {
      "type": "Number",
      "description": "Returns a {Number}."
    }
  ]
}
```

data.title: Allow Atom on Windows to run multiple instances e.g. on Windows server
data.body: Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/9459

data.title: Fix documentation for TextEditor::indentationForBufferRow()
data.body:
I think it is meant that `bufferRow` be the argument.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6546430/18963627/78e15cf2-867e-11e6-8986-4e0fa3a10087.png)

data.title: Wrong documentation for TextEditor::indentation
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [ ] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [ ] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [ ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [ ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [ ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

[Description of the bug or feature]
### Steps to Reproduce
1. [First Step]
2. [Second Step]
3. [and so on...]

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.
